page.title: 04Park Farm,Titchfield
page.content: There are some interesting aspects of Park Farm.One interesting aspect is the well.The well was suspected of being there by John Pratt. He noticed it when it rained very heavily and the water ran away. The stone was pulled up and underneath was a Georgian well built around 200 years ago. Another object is the fire place. The fire place was found when the house was being decorated. It was found behind a wall. The Reeve (or local tax collector) used the house as a hunting lodge and in the fire place they roasted the wild boar. The cellar was an inportant part of the house. In the Reeve's time the cellar would be full of wine. Many years ago the surroundings were woods and fields. These were used by the Reeve as a hunting area for wild boar.
